title: How to feel about the fact that high school, even elementary students, are trained in science and technology at a young age - Quora

response.answer_text: That is a good thing. Without that we wouldn’t have children inspired to become astronauts, doctors, researchers, chemists, inventors, and so many more. Science teaches reasoning and often allows children to have an island of secularism in a sea of toxic Christian beliefs. It truly sounds like you dislike all this which I can only assume is because it gives children and teenagers information and the ability to dissent. If we didn’t have science, I wouldn’t want to be an Antarctic and marine researcher, and so many other people wouldn’t have other dreams or goals. STEAM is a good thing.

As long as it remains in balance with other things it is great! Actually science and math research show us that young children already come with skills in there areas - we just need to support their use and growth instead of squashing them. A study was done that shows babies around 6 months can subitize - if three piles of blocks, with various numbers are laid out and they are given a verbal number - they look at the corresponding pile - that’s before they’ve even learned to count. Children are natural scientists - curious, anxious to learn and explore. Additionally, and most importantly - 90% of brain development occurs in early childhood - by age 5. So actually, elementary school is a bit late to start - the foundation of our entire lives in all areas is set by the time we are 5. We are doing children a disservice if we don’t give them a well rounded educational experience at any age.
